heading: Tonight
text: Rain and showers, not in southern NH until after midnight. Lows in the 40s northwest to 50s southeast. Southwest winds near 10 mph, shifting to the northwest.

heading: Wednesday
text: Showers ending through Quebec, south to the Adirondacks and Rt. 2 by mid morning, farther south and east late morning and afternoon, followed by some clearing in NY in the morning, east in the afternoon, last in NH. Breezy and much cooler. Highs in the 50s to near 60 north, in the 60s south. Northwest winds becoming north 10 to 15 mph, gusting 20 to 30 mph.

heading: Wednesday Night
text: Clearing, except periods of clouds northeast. Chilly. Lows in the 30s, near 30 over the higher terrain north. Winds northwest 10 to 15 mph, gusting 20 to 30 mph, diminishing in wind-sheltered valleys.

heading: Thursday
text: Mostly sunny, breezy, and quite cool. Highs only in the upper 40s to mid 50s north to south. Winds north to northwest 10 to 15 mph, decreasing through the afternoon.
